paragraphs.body: Welcome to the Avatar Wiki Fanon Awards!
paragraphs.text: Welcome to the Avatar Wiki Fanon Awards!

paragraphs.body: The Avatar Wiki Fanon Awards are awards designed to acknowledge outstanding achievements on the fanon portal and recognize the hard work of fan fiction authors. They are run like any other award ceremony, nominated and voted for by the Avatar Wiki Community. The ${link_0} makes sure every ceremony runs as smooth as possible.

paragraphs.body:
There will be a maximum of five fanon nominations per category.
 The Council lists three of the five nominations.
 The Avatar Wiki Community lists the remaining two nominations.
 In order to nominate or vote for a fanon, a user must have made a minimum of fifty edits and be an active contributor for a month.

The nominees must be eligible for the category they are nominated for, according to the date of eligibility.
 Stories and users nominated must have published or revised new content during or after December 2015.
 Stories will be considered "new" if they were created during or after December 2015.  Authors will be considered "new" if they made their debut onto the fanon portal during or after December 2015.
 Previous winners of a given category may not be nominated again.

paragraphs.body:
After the announcement of the Council nominations, the community has five days to propose other nominations on the current ceremony's talk page.
 Community may not nominate a fanon that is already nominated by the Council for the same category.
 Nominations of own work are not allowed.
 The community may nominate multiple fanon pages of the same author, even of the same series for a category, but note that only the best of these "double nominations" will proceed to the official nomination stage.

paragraphs.body: After this, another five day period will start in which voting on the community nominations will be opened. A Council member will declare the voting open at 12:00 EST (noon).

paragraphs.body:
The one or two fanons for each category with the most community support will be added on the official nomination page with the Council's suggestions.
 No fanon may be officially nominated twice, so if the top two voted fanons are of the same fanon, the one with the fewest votes will be replaced by the first runner up of another fanon.
 If there is a tie between fanons for the second nomination spot, the Council will decide which one proceeds to the official nomination stage.
